alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 9:57PM CDT until July 30 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern St. Clair County in west central Missouri... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 957 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Warsaw to near Osceola to 6 miles northeast of El Dorado Springs, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Truman Lake, Collins, Roscoe, Vista, Gerster, Tiffin, Harper and Iconium. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Kansas City. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
